definitions.definition: a piece of clothing that is worn over the foot, ankle and lower part of the leg, especially inside a shoe

examples.text: He had odd socks on, one red and one yellow.
John sat down and took off his shoes and socks.
Wear cotton socks indoors to protect your feet from the cold.
The children all wore white knee socks.
tube socks (= socks without a shaped heel)

definitions.definition: a hard hit, especially with the fist

examples.text: He gave him a sock on the jaw.

definitions.definition: to surprise or impress somebody very much
to try to improve your performance, work, behaviour, etc.

examples.text: You're going to have to pull your socks up.

definitions.definition: used to tell somebody to stop talking or making a noise

examples.text: Can't you put a sock in it? I'm trying to work.

wordOrigin: Old English socc ‘light shoe’, of Germanic origin, from Latin soccus ‘comic actor's shoe, light low-heeled slipper’, from Greek sukkhos.
